remarks: A natural transformation is an isomorphism of functors iff all its components are isomorphisms.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Jan-2017.)
statement:
fuciso.q $e |- Q = ( C FuncCat D ) $.
fuciso.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
fuciso.n $e |- N = ( C Nat D ) $.
fuciso.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( C Func D ) ) $.
fuciso.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( C Func D ) ) $.
fuciso.i $e |- I = ( Iso ` Q ) $.
fuciso.j $e |- J = ( Iso ` D ) $.
fuciso $p |- ( ph -> ( A e. ( F I G ) <-> ( A e. ( F N G ) /\ A. x e. B ( A ` x ) e. ( ( ( 1st ` F ) ` x ) J ( ( 1st ` G ) ` x ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d C x $.
$d D x $.
$d F x $.
$d G x $.
$d I x $.
$d J x $.
$d N x $.
$d Q x $.
$d ph x $.
